member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.AzureFederatedTokenProvider.GetSignedAssertionFromFederatedTokenProvider(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Prototype of certificate-less authentication using a signed assertion acquired with Managed Identity (federated identity).

member.summary: Delegate to get the client assertion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ClientAssertion.#ctor(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Constructor of a ClientAssertion, which can be used instead of a client secret or client certificates to authenticate the confidential client application. See https://aka.ms/ms-id-web/client-assertions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ClientAssertionDescription
member.summary: Description of a client assertion in the application configuration. See https://aka.ms/ms-id-web/client-assertions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ClientAssertionDescription.#ctor(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Microsoft.Identity.Web.ClientAssertion}})
member.param: delegate providing the client assertion when it is necessary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ClientAssertionDescription.ClientAssertionProvider
member.summary: delegate to get the client assertion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ClientAssertionDescription.GetSignedAssertion(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the signed assertion (and refreshes it if needed).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.IdentityFederationOptions
member.summary: Options for configuring Identity Federation options. See https://aka.ms/ms-id-web/identity-federation.

members.member:
Is IdentityFederation enabled?
The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.IdentityFederationOptions.SubjectIdentifier
member.summary: The value is used to establish a connection between external workload identities and Azure Active Directory. If Azure AD is the issuer, this value should be the object ID of the managed identity service principal in the tenant that will be used to impersonate the app. Can be null if you are using the machine assigned managed identity. Needs to be assigned if you are using a user assigned managed identity.
